waste_profile.overall_summary: Mexico generates a significant amount of municipal solid waste, around 53 million tons per year, with a relatively high recycling rate of 5% compared to regional averages. However, a large portion (21%) is still disposed of in open dumps, posing environmental risks. Key challenges include improving waste collection coverage and diverting waste from landfills through increased recycling and composting.
